00027 #define MAX_CAT 10              // number of known catalogs
00028 #define MAX_GEN  6              // number of generic quantities
00029 #define MAX_URL  9              // number of known VizieR web address
00030 #define MAX_LINE 1025           // (maximum number of char)+1 with getline

00080                            const std::string urlCode="cds",
00081                            const std::string &fileName="");
00082       // read only the catalog description (i.e. fill the
00083       // m_quantities vector and m_code, etc.)
00084       // the method returns the number of quantities,
00085       // -1 if importDescription already done, -3 if catName is unknown

00088 
00089   int import(const std::string &fileName, const long maxRows=0,
00090              const std::string ext="1");
00091   int importWeb(const std::string catName, const std::string urlCode="cds",
00092                 const long maxRow=44000, const std::string &fileName="");
00093       // import method for loading an entire catalog without selection
00094       // * recognizes catalog name and identifies the files to load
00095       // * translates the generic quantities
00096       // * loads non-generic quantities
00097       // the method returns the number of loaded rows,
00098       // -1 if successful import already done, -3 if catName is unknown,
00099       // other negative number for loading error
00100 
00101   int importSelected(std::string &filter);
00102       // if a catalog description was already loaded, this method does
00103       // the same as import(). However, it applies selection criteria
00104       // such that quantities which are not passing the criteria are not 
00105       // loaded;
00106       // the method returns the number of loaded rows,
00107       // -1 if successful import already done, -2 if importDescription not done
00108       // other negative number for loading error      
00109 
00110   int saveText(const std::string &fileName, bool clobber=false);
00111       // save the catalog information presently in memory to a text file
00112       // the method returns 1 if successful, negative number otherwise
00113 
00114   int saveSelectedText(const std::string &fileName, bool clobber=false);
00115       // like saveText(), however, storing only the selected rows
00116       // the method returns 1 if successful, negative number otherwise
00117

00256   // All setting or unsetting of cuts immediately takes effect,
00257   // i.e. the value of the vector m_rowIsSelected is recalculated.

00259

00264       // idem on all quantities at once

00272       // unset all cuts on all quantities except the selection ellipse;

00280                     const double rot_deg=0.);

00299   int excludeS(const std::string name, const std::vector<std::string> &slist,
00300                const bool exact=false);

00303                const bool exact=false);
00304       // only include rows which have string value in the given list
00305   int excludeN(const std::string name, const std::vector<double> &listVal);
00306       // include rows which value is NOT around one numerical in list
00307       // AND value is inside the cut interval
00308   int useOnlyN(const std::string name, const std::vector<double> &listVal);
00309       // only include rows which value is around one numerical in list
00310       // AND is inside the cut interval
00311   int includeN(const std::string name, const std::vector<double> &listVal);
00312       // only include rows which value is around one numerical in list
00313       // OR is inside the cut interval
00314   int setRejectNaN(const std::string name, const bool rejectNaN);
00315       // set quantity member m_rejectNaN and apply
00316       // (if different from previous and quantity is selected)  
00317   int setMatchPercent(const std::string name, double percent);
00318   int setMatchEpsilon(const std::string name, const unsigned long step);
00319       // set quantity member m_precision and apply
00320       // (if quantity has a non empty selection list)   
00321   int checkValWithinCut(const std::string name, const double value,
00322                         bool *cutLow, bool *cutUp, int *checkResult);
00323       // check if value (that could be used for list selection) is incompatible
00324       // with the cut of given quantity
00325       // Is given value within interval cut (boolean true if cut exist) ?
00326       // 0 means within interval (or no cut, both boolean false)
00327       // negative if below LowerCut, positive if above UpperCut;
00328       // -2 or 2 if value and precision sphere outside cut (useOnlyN can't
00329       //         select anything, value useless for excludeS)
00330       // -1 or 1 if value outside cut but precision sphere cross cut

00340 /*  int setCutString(const std::string stringVal);*/
00341       // set the selection string m_selection

00343       // a) quantities are described by giving their name
00344       //    in square brackets, e.g. [f6cm]

00346       //   "[f6cm].geq.[f12cm].and.([hr1]-[hr2]).lt.2.3"
00347       //

00388   std::vector<std::vector<std::string> > m_strings;
00389       // stores all string contents of the catalog;
00390       // e.g. m_strings[3] gives you the vector containing
00391       // the values of quantity 3 from the catalog;
00392       // m_strings[3][25] gives you the value of quantity 3 for catalog entry 25
00393 
00394   // comment: the number string quantities in the catalog == m_strings.size()
00395 
00396   std::vector<std::vector<double> > m_numericals;
00397       // stores all numerical contents of the catalog
00398 
00399   // comment: the number of numerical quantities == m_numericals.size()
00400 
00401   long m_numOriRows;
00402       // maximal number of rows in CDS catalog
00403   long m_numRows;
00404       // number of catalog rows loaded into memory
00405       // ( == m_strings[0].size() if m_strings.size() != 0 which should always
00406       //   be true due to the existence of generic quantities )
00407       // ( also == m_numericals[0].size if m_numericals.size != 0 which should
00408       //   always be true due to the existence of generic quantities )
00409 
00410   std::vector<std::vector<unsigned long> > m_rowIsSelected; 
00411       // false by default, i.e. all bits to 0;
00412       // each vector column has m_numRows elements; for a given row:
00413       // first bit to 1 if all selection criteria are met
00414       // each following bits for one quantity criteria
00415 
00416   std::string m_selection;      // to contain a general cut which is parsed
00417                                 // by the method setCutString()
00418   bool m_criteriaORed;
00419       // if true: OR instead of AND between bits of m_rowIsSelected
00420 
00421   bool m_selRegion;
00422       // true if an elliptical region is to be selected;
00423       // default == false
00424   double m_selEllipseCentRA_deg;
00425       // the RA of the center of the ellipse (degrees)
00426   double m_selEllipseCentDEC_deg;
00427       // the DEC of the center of the ellipse (degrees)
00428   double m_selEllipseMinAxis_deg;
00429       // the size of the minor axis (degrees)
00430   double m_selEllipseMajAxis_deg;
00431       // the size of the major axis (degrees)
00432   double m_selEllipseRot_deg;
00433       // the rotation angle, i.e. the angle between major axis and the
00434       // celestial equator (degrees); default == 0
00435

00546 // Default constructor
00547 inline Catalog::Catalog() {
00548 
00549   m_code="";
00550   m_URL ="";
00551   m_catName   ="";
00552   m_catRef    ="";
00553   m_tableName ="";
00554   m_tableRef  ="";
00555   m_filename  ="";
00556   m_filePos   =0;
00557   m_posErrSys = -1.0;
00558   m_posErrFactor=1.0;  // "deg" by default
00559 
00560   m_numRows   =IMPORT_NEED;
00561   m_numOriRows=0;
00562   m_selection ="";
00563   m_criteriaORed=false;
00564   m_selRegion =false;
00565   // following four data members needed for efficient selection
00566   m_numSelRows=0;
00567   m_indexErr= -1;
00568   m_indexRA = -1;
00569   m_indexDEC= -1;
00570   try { m_selEllipse.assign(7, 0.0); }
00571   catch (const std::exception &err) {
00572     std::string errText;
00573     errText=std::string("EXCEPTION on creating m_selEllipse: ")+err.what();
00574     printErr("Catalog constructor", errText);
00575     throw;
00576   }
00577   verbosity=3;
00578   #ifdef DEBUG_CAT
00579   std::cout << "!! DEBUG Catalog constructor (sizes=" <<  m_quantities.size()
00580             <<","<< m_strings.size() <<","<< m_numericals.size() <<","
00581             << m_rowIsSelected.size() <<", m_selEllipse "<< m_selEllipse.size()
00582             << ")" << std::endl;
00583   #endif
00584 }
00585 
00586 /**********************************************************************/
00587 // Destructor needed to free memory
00588 inline Catalog::~Catalog() {
00589 
00590   #ifdef DEBUG_CAT
00591   std::cout << "!! DEBUG Catalog destructor on: "
00592             << m_tableName << std::endl;
00593   #endif
00594   deleteContent();
00595   deleteDescription();
00596 }
00597 
00598 /**********************************************************************/
00599 // check if import or importDescription already done
00600 inline int Catalog::checkImport(const std::string origin, const bool isDone) {
00601 
00602   int quantSize=m_quantities.size();
00603   if (quantSize > 0) {
00604     if (isDone) return quantSize;
00605     if (m_numRows <= 0) {
00606       printLog(2, "deleting previous Catalog description");
00607       deleteDescription();
00608       return IS_VOID;
00609     }
00610     printWarn(origin, "call 'deleteContent' before importing again");
00611     return IMPORT_BIS;
00612   }
00613   else {
00614     if (! isDone) return IS_VOID;
00615     printWarn(origin, "must first use one 'import' method");
00616     return IMPORT_NEED;
00617   }
00618 }
00619 
00620 /**********************************************************************/
00621 // check if catName is valid 
00622 inline int Catalog::checkCatName(const std::string origin,
00623                                  const std::string catName) {
00624 
00625   for (int i=0; i<MAX_CAT; i++) {
00626     if (Catalog::s_CatalogList[2*i] == catName) return i;
00627   }
00628   std::string errText;
00629   errText="given Catalog name ("+catName+") do not exist";
00630   printWarn(origin, errText);
00631   return BAD_CATNAME;
00632 }
00633 
00634 /**********************************************************************/
00635 // check if catalog was succesfully loaded and row exist
00636 inline int Catalog::checkSize_row(const std::string origin, const long row) {
00637 
00638   if (m_numRows <= 0) {
00639     printWarn(origin, "catalog is empty");
00640     return IS_VOID;
00641   }
00642   if ((row < 0) || (row >= m_numRows)) {
00643     std::ostringstream sortie;
00644     sortie << "row must be within [ 0, " << m_numRows-1 << "]";
00645     printWarn(origin, sortie.str());
00646     return BAD_ROW;
00647   }
00648   return m_numRows;
00649 }
00650 
00651 /**********************************************************************/
00652 // check if quantity name is valid
00653 inline int Catalog::checkQuant_name(const std::string origin,
00654                                     const std::string name) {
00655 
00656   int quantSize=m_quantities.size();
00657   for (int i=0; i<quantSize; i++) {
00658     if (m_quantities[i].m_name == name) return i;
00659   }
00660   std::string errText;
00661   errText="given Quantity name ("+name+") do not exist";
00662   printWarn(origin, errText);
00663   return BAD_QUANT_NAME;
00664 }
00665 
00666 /**********************************************************************/
00667 // check if catalog was succesfully loaded and selected row exist
00668 inline int Catalog::checkSel_row(const std::string origin, const long srow) {
00669 
00670   if (m_numRows <= 0) {
00671     printWarn(origin, "catalog is empty");
00672     return IS_VOID;
00673   }
00674   if (m_numSelRows == 0) {
00675     printWarn(origin, "no row is selected");
00676     return IS_VOID;
00677   }
00678   if ((srow < 0) || (srow >= m_numSelRows)) {
00679     std::ostringstream sortie;
00680     sortie << "row must be within [ 0, " << m_numSelRows-1 << "]";
00681     printWarn(origin, sortie.str());
00682     return BAD_ROW;
00683   }
00684   return m_numSelRows;
00685 }
00686 
00687 /**********************************************************************/
00688 // return long int to test m_quantities[index] bit in m_rowIsSelected[k]
00689 inline unsigned long Catalog::bitPosition(const int index, int *k) {
00690 
00691   unsigned long test=1ul;
00692   int pos=index+1; // position of given criteria in isSelected vector
00693   *k=(pos+1)/(sizeof(long)*8);
00694   // index of m_rowIsSelected with given criteria
00695   int i=pos+1-(*k)*sizeof(long)*8;
00696   // bit pos.of given criteria in m_rowIsSelected[k]
00697   int j=0;
00698   while (j < i) {test*=2ul; j++;}
00699 
00700   return test;
00701 }
